channel.title: Need BCEL help... again. ;(
channel.description:
Okay, here's what I'm trying to do. Scan the client, find shit, and add it to access methods just like regecks was doing. But I need to make it so ClientFunctions is importable so I can translate it into the universal AccessorMethods class. Java does not want this:
[img]http://img242.imageshack.us/img242/7455/lolexxe6.png[/img]
Here's everything that I'm using - http://id3y.com/shit/wtfux.rar. Thanks for you help.

item.title: Need BCEL help... again. ;(
item.dc:creator: @NOURLOL NOURLOL
item.description:
@NOURLOL wrote:

[quote=“White Castle, post:5, topic:10942”]Yeah I don’t think you looked at my code.

is the code for adding a method in ClientFunctions. How would I add runescape.jar to my classpath when compiling?[/quote]SO? I STILL ANSWERED YOUR QUESTION.

When compiling just add jagex’s runescape.jar to your classpath with -classpath .;runescape.jar;whateverelse

item.title: Need BCEL help... again. ;(
item.dc:creator: @White_Castle White Castle
item.description:
@White_Castle wrote:

Yeah I don’t think you looked at my code.

public void addAccessMethod(Type returntype, Type args[], String name, String classname, String fieldname) { log("Adding access method (" + returntype.toString() + ")" + name + "..."); String argnames[] = new String[args.length]; for(int i = 0; i < argnames.length; i++) { argnames[i] = "arg" + i; } InstructionList list = new InstructionList(); ConstantPoolGen poolgen = accessmethods.getConstantPool(); MethodGen methodgen = new MethodGen((ACC_PUBLIC | ACC_STATIC), returntype, args, argnames, name, accessmethods.getClassName(), list, poolgen); InstructionFactory factory = new InstructionFactory(accessmethods); list.append(factory.createGetStatic(classname, fieldname, returntype)); list.append(factory.createReturn(returntype)); accessmethods.addMethod(methodgen.getMethod()); }

is the code for adding a method in ClientFunctions. How would I add runescape.jar to my classpath when compiling?

Read full topic

item.title: Need BCEL help... again. ;(
item.dc:creator: @NOURLOL NOURLOL
item.description:
@NOURLOL wrote:

…
I don’t construct the class using source, purely bytecode.
Instead of:

return jd.dc

I do:

getstatic whateverType jd.dc areturn

And that’s why it works … I use bcel to construct the entire class, but my classes do it for me automatically, I just do createFieldAccess =)

Edit: Oh man I think I misread your post. The runescape.jar has to be in the classpath =P. If you’re going to try use the class it’s going to try resolove dependencies, runescape.jar needs to be in the classpath to compile any used classes.
Edit2: Maybe I didn’t, are you trying to create your methods by source?

Read full topic

item.title: Need BCEL help... again. ;(
item.dc:creator: @ruler ruler
item.description:
@ruler wrote:

very cool work, reminds me of regex’s code

It works if you remove your package structure and throw it all in one folder without this access .
or
I think you can instead have it return a java.Object and cast that to a listener.

make

public class ClientFunctions
{

    public ClientFunctions()
    {
    }

    public static Object getMouseWrapperObject()
    {
        return jc.dc;
    }
}
